CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 29, 1952, pg. 1 reads: "First Prize Winner - Mrs. Estelle Monk polled 67,050 votes and received a 17-inch Admiral Television Set with a built-in radio in ceremonies at A. Leo Weil School last Thursday. She is pictured, left, smothered in flowers and gifts given her by admiring friends.  Right: Mrs. Robert L. Vann, president of the Courier, is shown presenting a check for $100 to the Rev. B.F. Wright, pastor of the church of the winning contestant.  Five...contestants also won major prizes.  Six additional runners up received cash awards. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of prize winner Estelle Monk, unknown man, and Jessie Vann holding check, standing behind podium at A. Leo Weil School for "Favorite Churchwoman's" contest award program
